page.title: 06A SCOUT GROUP AT LONGTON
page.content: {Second Longton (Saint Andrew's) {Scout Group}is a sponsored open Group which has existed in Longton since 1935. There are now six sections, a Beaver Colony,2 Cub Scout Packs,2 Scout Troops and a Venture Scout Unit, making a total of 150 people. We also run a band with drums and bugles which, since April, has included a few Girl Guide players. This year the Cubs are concentrating on World Conservation. Everyone is collecting waste paper and glass for re-cycling. The boys have also learned how tuning a car engine helps to reduce the amount of pollution in the atmosphere. The Troops own 10 canoes and a dinghy but they have to tow them for 8 miles to the nearest suitable mere. The Venture Unit and Beaver Colony have been formed in the last 2 years.
